p: Among respondents, fear about economic impact of the epidemic was common, although they were not as much worried about losing their jobs. This finding is somewhat contrasting until we consider that most of the respondents were younger citizens and students, and that fear of job losses was the highest among university-level respondents, thus employed subsample. It also points out the fact that younger respondents are aware of the potential impact of the epidemic on society, especially since the unemployment and economic problems were identified as the biggest problems (41%) of Serbian youth [ 55].
